results.name: Triangle read by rows giving numbers of paths in a lattice satisfying certain conditions.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
D. Merlini, D. G. Rogers, R. Sprugnoli and M. C. Verri, On some alternative characterizations of Riordan arrays, Canad J. Math., 49 (1997), 301-320.
formula: T(n, k) = ((n-k+1)/(n+1))*Sum_{i=0..k/3} binomial(n+1, i)*binomial(n+k -3*i, n), for k <= n.
maple: a := proc(n,k) if k<=n then (n-k+1)*sum(binomial(n+1,i)*binomial(n+k-3*i,n),i=0..k/3)/(n+1) else 0 fi end;
mathematica: Table[((n-k+1)/(n+1))*Sum[Binomial[n+1, j]*Binomial[n+k-3*j, n], {j, 0, k/3}], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 17 2019 *)
program: (PARI) {T(n,k) = ((n-k+1)/(n+1))*sum(j=0, floor(k/3), binomial(n+1, j)* binomial(n+k -3*j, n))}; \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 17 2019
